clinical_study.brief_title: An Extension Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, Efficacy, and Treatment Adherence of Dapsone in Acne Vulgaris

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: This study will assess the safety, tolerability, and efficacy of dapsone in subjects with acne vulgaris following 12 weeks of treatment.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Study was never initiated due to company decision. No study subjects were ever enrolled or dosed.
clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Inflammatory Lesion Count

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Non-Inflammatory Lesion Count
Change from Baseline in Total Lesion Count
Percentage of Subjects With a Global Acne Assessment Score (GAAS) of 0 or 1

arm_group.description: Dapsone Formulation A applied once daily to the face and upper chest, upper back, and shoulders (as per protocol) for 12 weeks.
Dapsone Formulation B applied once daily to the face and upper chest, upper back, and shoulders (as per protocol) for 12 weeks.
Dapsone Formulation C applied once daily to the face and upper chest, upper back, and shoulders (as per protocol) for 12 weeks.
Dapsone 5% gel (ACZONE®) applied twice daily to the face and upper chest, upper back, and shoulders (as per protocol) for 12 weeks.
